thread.title: Canada Basketball won't bid on Olympic qualifying tournament
thread.title_full: Canada Basketball won't bid on Olympic qualifying tournament | Toronto Star

author: Doug Smith
title: Canada Basketball won't bid on Olympic qualifying tournament
text:
BURNABY, B.C.—Canada Basketball has decided not to bid on hosting one of the last-ditch Olympic qualification tournaments next year for men, according to sources.
The economics — it’s about a $5 million undertaking — just don’t work and organization officials tried for about three weeks to figure it out before coming to that realization.
No small part was the fact the July 5-12 period for the qualifications events coincides with a Microsoft world congress in Toronto that’ll take over the Air Canada Centre, taking the largest market in the country out of the mix.
Canada will placed in November in one of three six-team tournaments to round out the 12-team field for the 2016 Rio Olympics after failing to qualify directly at the FIBA Americas championship in Mexico City earlier this month.
FIBA, the sport’s world governing body, has given no indication how it will seed the 18 teams in the final qualification process.
